column4: i'd like to know how to boot 8.10 from ISO without using a CD or USB. I'm running 8.04 Hardy
so you mean how to 'netboot' ?
if that's what that is, then yes
to boot an iso file you can do that with grub2.. but that would need a usb with grub2 installed on it
otherwise you are going to have to do some other type of booting
How can I enable my USB drive to mount a flash drive?
Huh?  I plug my flash drive in and ubuntu mounts it..
mine always says "Cannot mount volume"
could be a typo in /etc/fstab I had one install that had the cdrom as sdc  when sdc was the usb  drives
I'm quite the newbie. Should i type any specific command that would allow my USB drive to work? Sorry if i sound redundant
it should work automatically.
typing /etc/fstab?
No.. /etc/fstab defines mountpoints.
if you have more then 1 flash drive try plugging in all of them . see if any get auto mounted
I'll try that once I get home in a few hours.  What if that doesn't work?
No idea really. ive had issues with automopunting since beta.. still not sure whats crashing. they will automount for about 10 min.. then stop. If i logout/in then it goes back to automounting them
you could alwyas plug them in and mount them byhand
I'm using a Sandisk Cruzer. I've heard removing the U3 software from the flash drive will help.
the u3 stuff really screws things up the device shows up as a CD and a hard drive. I always repartition and get rid of the u3 stuff
Well i'm using a Kingston flash drive until I find my Sandisk. Once I find my Sandisk I'll remove U3 from it.
I'm a broke college kid.
2gb flash drive less then the cost of a meal at McDonolds this time of year
You're right. I could probably round up some funds for a new flash drive.
Is that all I need? A 2gb flash? I plan on using that to boot Jaunty on my computer. Oh, another question. Will I lose my information moving from 8.04 to 8.10?
